post_text:
HOPKINS ELEMENTARY CELEBRATION....
Now that the "Stay Home, Stay Safe" order has been relaxed, the staff at Hopkins Elementary would like to invite all families to join us in the bus loop on Friday, June 5th between 5:00-6:00pm for a "Drive Thru" send off to Summer Vacation!!! All students and family members will need to stay in their vehicles as they drive through the bus loop. The HES Staff will line the sidewalk to wave and see students one last time to wrap up the 2019-20 school year.

(Students who still have library books are encouraged to bring them and we will have a box for collection. 3rd-5th grade students who have their school issued Chromebook at home are able to return them at this time as well.)

post_text:
Reminder...

Hopkins Elementary's schedule for student items/learning material distribution
Location: Hopkins Elementary Bus Loop
Y5/K and 1st Grade: Monday, April 20th 9:00am-12:00pm
2nd and 3rd Grade: Monday, April 20th 5:00-7:00pm
4th and 5th Grade: Tuesday, April 21st 10:00am-12:00pm
(If a family has siblings in the building, they can pick up all of their children's materials at one time.)

Parents, please do not leave your vehicles. If you are ill or have been exposed to someone who is ill in the last 48 hours, please contact your building principal and make alternate arrangements for pickup. You will be greeted by a staff member who will "take your order" and radio the student information to staff members inside the building. We will gather all belongings and needed academic materials and deliver it to you curbside. This will eliminate the need for the community to enter the building. Staff members will be following social distancing guidelines including wearing masks and gloves.
Please follow the recommended times to help us complete this process in a timely manner.

post_text:
On Thursday, January 23rd Don Cochrane from Camp Kaskitowa in Allegan will be joining the 3rd grade classrooms for a Michigan History presentation.

Michigan 1763 Living History Presentations:

Michigan Living History presentation; like a field trip in your own classroom. Meet a Coureur de Bois (French-Canadian
Independent fur trader) who will interact with your students and help them understand what life was like in Michigan 250 years ago. Understand the impact Native American cultures (Potawatomi, Ojibwa, Ottawa, and Huron) and European Colonial cultures (French, British) had on each other in 1763 during Michigan’s colonial period. Also, learn about the tools and skills needed to survive in the North Woods over 250 years ago. Presenter will be in historically correct dress and have tools of the trade for living in the wilderness including tomahawks, knives, and musket with black powder.
text:
On Thursday, January 23rd Don Cochrane from Camp Kaskitowa in Allegan will be joining the 3rd grade classrooms for a Michigan History presentation.

Michigan 1763 Living History Presentations:

Michigan Living History presentation; like a field trip in your own classroom. Meet a Coureur de Bois (French-Canadian
Independent fur trader) who will interact with your students and help them understand what life was like in Michigan 250 years ago. Understand the impact Native American cultures (Potawatomi, Ojibwa, Ottawa, and Huron) and European Colonial cultures (French, British) had on each other in 1763 during Michigan’s colonial period. Also, learn about the tools and skills needed to survive in the North Woods over 250 years ago. Presenter will be in historically correct dress and have tools of the trade for living in the wilderness including tomahawks, knives, and musket with black powder.

post_text: A special thanks goes out to HME Ahrens-Fox for their support!!!
shared_text:
HME Ahrens-Fox
December 19, 2019 at 4:53 PM ·

Members of the HME Ahrens-Fox family were blessed this week with the great privilege of escorting students and faculty of Hopkins Public Schools in a delivery of hope for the holidays to the patients of the Helen DeVos Children's Hospital. This annual charity drive is organized by Jason and Allison Babiak as a means of paying forward and honoring a similar kismet act of kindness granted to their son in 2014. Dawson Babiak, a cancer survivor and former patient of HDCH, was gifted a package of window markers while receiving treatment. This simple display of compassion provided him with a jumpstart towards recovery. Five years later, through the generosity of the families and students of the Hopkins Public School District, a single package of markers has grown to an entire bus loaded with toys.

We are grateful for the opportunity to join the Babiak family and the students from HPS in this heartwarming display of consideration towards those who can truly benefit from it this holiday season.
text:
A special thanks goes out to HME Ahrens-Fox for their support!!!

HME Ahrens-Fox
December 19, 2019 at 4:53 PM ·

Members of the HME Ahrens-Fox family were blessed this week with the great privilege of escorting students and faculty of Hopkins Public Schools in a delivery of hope for the holidays to the patients of the Helen DeVos Children's Hospital. This annual charity drive is organized by Jason and Allison Babiak as a means of paying forward and honoring a similar kismet act of kindness granted to their son in 2014. Dawson Babiak, a cancer survivor and former patient of HDCH, was gifted a package of window markers while receiving treatment. This simple display of compassion provided him with a jumpstart towards recovery. Five years later, through the generosity of the families and students of the Hopkins Public School District, a single package of markers has grown to an entire bus loaded with toys.

We are grateful for the opportunity to join the Babiak family and the students from HPS in this heartwarming display of consideration towards those who can truly benefit from it this holiday season.

post_text:
Come Sing with us!

4th and 5th Grade Choir Club:

We are continuing the after-school 4th and 5th grade choir club at Hopkins Elementary AND Sycamore Elementary that starts in January! (also open to St. Stan’s and St. Mary’s students)

Directed by Mr. Jacob Oaster (Hopkins Middle & High School Choir Teacher)

Depending on the location you choose, practices will be at:

Hopkins Elementary: on Various Tuesdays

Sycamore Elementary: on Various Wednesdays

*(see your school’s main office OR Music Teacher for an information packet and a list of dates of our club rehearsals)



A completed Permission Slip is necessary to attend. (see your information packet)
text:
Come Sing with us!

4th and 5th Grade Choir Club:

We are continuing the after-school 4th and 5th grade choir club at Hopkins Elementary AND Sycamore Elementary that starts in January! (also open to St. Stan’s and St. Mary’s students)

Directed by Mr. Jacob Oaster (Hopkins Middle & High School Choir Teacher)

Depending on the location you choose, practices will be at:

Hopkins Elementary: on Various Tuesdays

Sycamore Elementary: on Various Wednesdays

*(see your school’s main office OR Music Teacher for an information packet and a list of dates of our club rehearsals)



A completed Permission Slip is necessary to attend. (see your information packet)

We appreciate your support!

post_text: Our hearts go out to the families of all those affected by the tragedy in Florida. As educators, we know these types of incidents can cause a wide range of responses in students. If your student is having a difficult time, please have them speak to an adult in their building. Our teachers, counselors, administrators and support staff are all ready and willing to help.

post_text:
As a parent or caregiver of a school-aged child, your opinion matters when it comes to reporting on how well schools serve Michigan’s children. Please provide feedback on Michigan’s new, online “transparency dashboard” and help shape how Michigan reports school performance. goo.gl/KmW2HY

Michigan’s new online “transparency dashboard” reports on more than 20 measures of school performance for every public school in Michigan, including public school academies (charter schools). Check it out and share your comments through this online survey. goo.gl/KmW2HY

Only [fill in #] days left to voice your opinion on Michigan’s online “transparency dashboard.” Help shape how parents and caregivers learn about school quality on measures that matter to them. The feedback survey closes November 15. goo.gl/KmW2HY

post_text: Hopkins Public Schools received this donation today from the Gun Lake Tribe to use towards purchasing technology at the elementary level. All Kindergarten, 1st and 2nd grade classrooms will be getting 10 IPads. We will also be purchasing mobile carts of Chromebooks for the 3rd, 4th and 5th grade students.
text: Hopkins Public Schools received this donation today from the Gun Lake Tribe to use towards purchasing technology at the elementary level. All Kindergarten, 1st and 2nd grade classrooms will be getting 10 IPads. We will also be purchasing mobile carts of Chromebooks for the 3rd, 4th and 5th grade students.
